title.narrative: Immediate response to create temporary shelter and basic liveability conditions for hurricane Matthew affected people in the municipalities of Baracoa and Maisí in province of Guantánamo, Cuba

description.narrative: The project aims to improve coverage of basic liveability conditions for 31,623 people due to hurricane Matthew in Baracoa and Maisí in Guantánamo. UNDP will provide non-food relief items and temporary and semi-temporary shelter for hurricane-affected people. The project will ensure the protection of families whose houses have had their roofs lost, collapsed or damaged and have lost their personal belongings. Two roofing modules have been developed to speed up immediate recovery actions by families themselves. This will make it possible to promote safe cooking, safe water consumption, and supply mattresses to vulnerable groups.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Immediate response to create temporary shelter and basic liveability conditions for hurricane Matthew affected people in the municipalities of Baracoa and Maisí in province of Guantánamo, Cuba

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS CUBA RAPID RESPONSE STORM 2016

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
